REFERENDUM.Definition: a vote where people chose yes or no on a big issue

EASING.Definition: making them less hard or strict

SCANDAL.Definition: an event that caused public feelings of shock and anger

OUTCASTS.Definition: people who were not accepted by the rest of society

ASHAMED.Definition: feeling bad or guilty about it

GROSSLY.Definition: in a very bad or wrong way

ENTITLED.Definition: having the right to get it

PRIORITISE.Definition: list or rate as the the most important thing

RESTRICTIVE.Definition: stopping people from doing things easily

ANCESTRY.Definition: family members who lived a long time ago

STRICTER.Definition: having more rules or being harder

REFERENDUMS.Definition: votes where people say yes or no on big issues

TURNOUT.Definition: the number of people who went to vote

TRADE UNIONS.Definition: groups of workers who joined together to ask for better pay or work

COALITION.Definition: a group of different people or parties working together

OUT OF TOUCH WITH.Definition: not informed or not having the same ideas as most people about it

LOOMING.Definition: about to happen and regarded as ominous or worrying

DEMOGRAPHIC.Definition: relating to the structure or characteristics of populations

LOOSENING.Definition: making them less tight or less strict

INHERITED.Definition: received from one's parents or ancestors

POLARISING.Definition: making people split into two opposite groups

PULL FACTOR.Definition: something that would make people want to come

COHESION.Definition: forming a united whole, sticking together

MOBILISE.Definition: bring people together to take action

BASE.Definition: the group of people who support them

FRAMED.Definition: showed or explained in this way

PRAGMATIC.Definition: doing what works best, not just what sounds good

ERODE.Definition: slowly take away or break down

BOYCOTT.Definition: not take part in it, as a protest

BINDING.Definition: involving an obligation that cannot be broken, conclusive

CHEERS.Definition: expressions of encouragement, praise, or joy

DISMAY.Definition: a feeling of sadness or worry

ASSIMILATION.Definition: when someone becomes part of a new group or culture

GENERATIONAL.Definition: connected with the relationship between generations

ANCESTORS.Definition: family members from a long time ago

HERITAGE.Definition: the culture and history received from their family

CARBONARA.Definition: an italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese and bacon

CRACKS.Definition: problems or weak parts in the system

CORE.Definition: the most important or central part

LIBERALLY.Definition: in a free or open way
